title: DATS study schema
description: Process to acquire data on a sample and attempt to draw conclusions about the population the sample has been selected from, executing a plan and design.

name.description: The name of the activity, usually one sentece or short description of the study.

description.description: A textual narrative comprised of one or more statements describing the study.

types.description: The types of study (e.g. intervention or observation or meta-analysis or clinical trials, or behavioural study, or the study design).

startDate.description: A timestamp to record the starting point of the activity.

endDate.description: A timestamp to record the end point of the activity.

dates.description: Relevant dates for the datasets, a date must be added, e.g. creation date or last modification date should be added.

duration.description: The time during which the activity takes place.

location.description: The location where the activity takes place.

performedBy.description: The person(s) or organisation(s) responsible for executing the process.

keywords.description: Tags associated with the activity, which will help in its discovery.

output.description: The entities resulting from applying the activity.

schedulesActivity.description: The activities scheduled by the study.

schedulesDataAcquisition.description: The kind of techniques and response variables used during a study for acquiring data.

selectionCriteria.description: The attributes and values that the material should meet in order to be part of the group.

studyGroups.description: The different study groups associated with a study.

usesReagent.description: The materials that are used as reagents (but not subjects) of the study.

isAboutBiologicalEntity.description: The biological entities relevant to the study, ideally from a controlled vocabulary/ontology such as Gene Ontology.

extraProperties.description: Extra properties that do not fit in the previous specified attributes.
